resources.string: Move the phone to detect surfaces. Tap + to set a point on the crosshair position.
Calibration (1/2): place a card on a flat surface. Align the crosshair with one corner and tap +.
Calibration (2/2): move the crosshair to the opposite corner (diagonal) and tap +.
Measure real-world distances by placing two points on AR-detected surfaces.

string-array.name: aruler_help_requirements
string-array.item: Good lighting and a textured surface (wood, fabric, etc.).
Move the phone in a “figure-8” pattern to help plane detection.

string-array.name: aruler_help_steps
string-array.item: Point at the floor or table until the reticle turns green.
Tap the “+” button to place the first point at the reticle position.
Aim at the second position and tap “+” to place the second point.
A line is drawn between the points and the distance label appears in the middle.
You can keep creating measurements; previous ones remain visible and go to the history.

string-array.name: aruler_help_buttons
string-array.item: “+”: places a point at the reticle position.
Reset: clears all points and measurements.
cm/m ↔ in/ft: switches the unit system.
Calibrate card: measure a credit or debit card diagonal to adjust the scale.

string-array.name: aruler_help_tips
string-array.item: For stability, keep the phone ~0.5–1.5 m from the surface.
If the reticle doesn’t turn green, move the phone slowly to explore the plane.

string-array.name: aruler_help_troubles
string-array.item: Surface not detected: improve lighting or aim at textured materials.
Unstable measurements: recalibrate or place points closer to each other.
Distance seems off: run the card calibration again.

resources.string: The camera is used only for measurement; no photos or videos are recorded.
